parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders. To list several orders the orders must be separated by comma.

parameters.name: countryId
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders of one country. The id of the country must be specified.

parameters.name: orderItemName
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search results to orders with a certain item name. The name of the item must be specified.

parameters.name: variationNumber
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search results to orders with a specific variation number. The number of the variation must be specified.

parameters.name: sender.contact
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search results to orders with a specific sender of the type contact. The id of the sender must be specified.

parameters.name: sender.warehouse
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search results to orders with a specific sender of the type warehouse. The id of the sender must be specified.

parameters.name: receiver.contact
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search results to orders with a specific receiver of the type contact. The id of the receiver must be specified.

parameters.name: receiver.warehouse
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search results to orders with a specific receiver of the type warehouse. The id of the receiver must be specified.

parameters.name: externalOrderId
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to an external order id. The external order id must be specified.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to order from one client. The id of the client must be specified.

parameters.name: paymentStatus
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to order with a specific payment status. Valid values are unpaid,partlyPaid,fullyPaid,overpaid. One value must be specified.

parameters.name: updatedAtFrom
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders that were last updated on the specified date. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: updatedAtTo
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders that were last updated within a specified period of time. This filter can be used alone or can be combined with the UpdatedAtFrom filter. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: createdAtFrom
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders that were created on the specified date. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: createdAtTo
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders that were created within a certain period of time. This filter can be used alone or can be combined with the CreatedAtFrom filter. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: paidAtFrom
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders that received a payment on the specified date. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: paidAtTo
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders that received a payment within a certain period of time. This filter can be used alone or can be combined with the paidAtFrom filter. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: outgoingItemsBookedAtFrom
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders where the outgoing items were booked on the specified date. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: outgoingItemsBookedAtTo
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders where the outgoing items were booked within a specified period of time. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: statusFrom
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders in a specific order status. The value of the order status must be specified.

parameters.name: statusTo
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders within a range of order statuses. This filter can be used alone or can be combined with the statusFrom filter. The value of the order status must be specified.

parameters.name: hasDocument
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders which hold the given document type. Valid values are multi_invoice, multi_credit_note, success_confirmation, return_note, pickup_delivery, repair_bill, dunning_letter, offer, order_confirmation, credit_note, correction_document, delivery_note, invoice, invoice_external, receipt

parameters.name: hasDocumentNumber
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to orders which hold documents with given number.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to get. The default page that will be returned is page 1.

parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of orders to be displayed per page. The default number of orders per page is 50.

parameters.name: with
parameters.description:
Load additional relations for an order. Currently possible are:
  • 'addresses' = The address objects that are associated with the order.
  • 'relations' = The order relation reference instances that are associated with the order. These instances contain information such as the the reference type, the ID of the reference and the relation itself.
  • 'comments' = The order comments.
  • 'location' = The accounting location of the order.
  • 'payments' = The payments that are associated with the order.
  • 'documents' = The documents that are associated with the order.
  • 'contactSender' = The associated contact for the contact-sender relation.
  • 'contactReceiver' = The associated contact for the contact-receiver relation.
  • 'warehouseSender' = The associated warehouse for the warehouse-sender relation.
  • 'warehouseReceiver' = The associated warehouse for the warehouse-receiver relation.
  • 'orderItems.variation' = The variation that is associated with the order item.
  • 'orderItems.giftCardCodes' = The gift card codes that are associated with the order item.
  • 'orderItems.transactions' = The transactions that are associated with the order item.
  • 'orderItems.serialNumbers' = The serial numbers that are associated with the order item.
  • 'orderItems.variationBarcodes' = The barcodes that are associated with variation of the order item.
  • 'orderItems.comments' = The comments that are associated with the order item.
  • 'originOrderReferences' = The references to other orders, e.g. returns or credit notes, associated with this order.
  • deprecated 'orderItems.warehouseLocations' = The warehouse locations that are associated with the order item.
Example: ?with[]=addresses&with[]=orderItems.variation

    Advance order = 8
    Multi-order = 9
    Multi credit note = 10
    Multi delivery = 11
    Reorder = 12
    Partial delivery = 13
    Subscription = 14
    Redistribution = 15

post.description:
Validates if multiple coupon codes can be used for the specified items, contact ID, etc. At least one code must be specified. Only one coupon code for special offers (promotional code) can be specified. Promotional codes are validated first. Gift card codes are validated and redeemed after the promotional code to ensure that any discounts are calculated correctly.
If any coupon code is invalid, a CouponCodeValidation object with an exception parameter will be added to the list. If the coupon code is valid, a CouponCodeValidation object will be added to the list.

Create an order referrer. The ID can be specified, a parent ID can be specified to create a sub referrer or if no ID is specified, a referrer ID will be assigned automatically.
If an ID is specified, the ID may not be used already. If the ID is used already, the referrer will only be created.
If the ID is automatically assigned, the first ID that has not been used before will be set.
If the ID is not specified, but a parent referrer ID is given, then the new referrer ID will be a sub referrer of the given parent.

parameters.name: with
parameters.description:
Load additional relations for an order. Currently possible are: *
  • 'addresses' = The address objects that are associated with the order.
  • 'relations' = The order relation reference instances that are associated with the order. These instances contain information such as the the reference type, the ID of the reference and the relation itself.
  • 'comments' = The order comments.
  • 'location' = The accounting location of the order.
  • 'payments' = The payments that are associated with the order.
  • 'documents' = The documents that are associated with the order.
  • 'contactSender' = The associated contact for the contact-sender relation.
  • 'contactReceiver' = The associated contact for the contact-receiver relation.
  • 'warehouseSender' = The associated warehouse for the warehouse-sender relation.
  • 'warehouseReceiver' = The associated warehouse for the warehouse-receiver relation.
  • 'orderItems.variation' = The variation that is associated with the order item.
  • 'orderItems.giftCardCodes' = The gift card codes that are associated with the order item.
  • 'orderItems.transactions' = The transactions that are associated with the order item.
  • 'orderItems.serialNumbers' = The serial numbers that are associated with the order item.
  • 'orderItems.variationBarcodes' = The barcodes that are associated with variation of the order item.
  • 'orderItems.comments' = The comments that are associated with the order item.
  • deprecated 'orderItems.warehouseLocations' = The warehouse locations that are associated with the order item.
Example: ?with[]=addresses&with[]=orderItems.variation

parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to documents that were created within a certain period of time. This filter can be used alone or can be combined with the CreatedAtFrom filter. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: displayDateFrom
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to documents that were displayed on the specified date. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

parameters.name: displayDateTo
parameters.description: Filter that restricts the search result to documents that were displayed within a certain period of time. This filter can be used alone or can be combined with the displayDateFrom filter. The date has to be in the W3C format, e.g. '2016-10-24T13:33:23+02:00'.

typeId.description:
The ID of the order type
                                                              It is possible to define individual order types. However,
                                                              the following types are available by default:

    Sales order = 1
    Delivery = 2
    Returns = 3
    Credit note = 4
    Warranty = 5
    Repair = 6
    Offer = 7
    Advance order = 8
    Multi-order = 9
    Multi credit note = 10
    Multi delivery = 11
    Reorder = 12
    Partial delivery = 13
    Subscription = 14
    Redistribution = 15
 optional allowed values are 15

own
amazon

parameters.name: plentyID
parameters.description: Cookie from a successful login.

id.description: The ID of the log entry

createdAt.description: The date when the log entry was created

integration.description: The integration key used for the log entry. Used as a first level allocation.

identifier.description: The identifier used for the log entry. Used as a second level allocation.

code.description: The code for this current log entry. For log entries with level "debug", "info", "notice", "warning" and "report" this needs to have an translation in order to be stored.

referenceType.description: Deprecated field, see the references field instead.

referenceValue.description: Deprecated field, see the references field instead.

level.description: The level this current log entry belongs to. Notice! When storing log entries with level "report" the entries will actually be stored as level "info". The difference between "report" and "info" is that log entries with level "report" do not need prior activation.

additionalInfo.description: Additional information that need to also be stored. Can be an int, string or object.

references.description: All the reference types and values correlated with this log entry.

The rating of the contact. This rating is for internal use only. 5 red stars are for the worst and 5 yellow stars for the best rating. Possible values:
  • -5 = 5 red stars (worst rating)
  • -4 = 4 red stars
  • -3 = 3 red stars
  • -2 = 2 red stars
  • -1 = 1 red star
  • 0 = 5 grey stars, no rating saved for the contact
  • 1 = 1 yellow star
  • 2 = 2 yellow stars
  • 3 = 3 yellow stars
  • 4 = 4 yellow stars
  • 5 = 5 yellow stars (best rating)

createdAt.description: The time the order summary was created as unix timestamp

updatedAt.description: The time the order summary was last updated as unix timestamp

id.description: The ID of the accounting location

countryId.description: The ID of the country of the accounting location

name.description: The name of the accounting location

clientId.description: The ID of the client that the accounting location belongs to

plentyId.description: The plenty ID of the client that the accounting location belongs to

locationId.description: The ID of the accounting location

isInvoiceEUNet.description: Is the invoice net for EU?

isInvoiceExportNet.description: Is the invoice net for export?

showShippingVat.description: Show the vat for shipping costs on the invoice?

numberOfDecimalPlaces.description: The number of decimal places for prices

id.description: The ID of the debtor account configuration

locationId.description: The ID of the accounting location that the debtor account is associated with.

mode.description:
The mode describes the criteria based on which pending amounts are assigned to a debtor account. The following modes are available:
  • character = The debtor accounts are selected based on the first character of customer information. The information and the order of the information that will be used are defined with the sequence. There are 3 different sequences available.
  • payment = The debtor accounts are selected based on the payment method.
  • country = The debtor accounts are selected based on the country of delivery.
  • country_payment = The debtor accounts are selected based on two criteria. The first criteria is the country and if the country is same as the country of the accounting location then the payment method is used to select the deptor account.

sequence.description:
The sequence defines the order in which customer information will be used for the debtor account assignment if the character made has been chosen. The following sequences are available:
  • FNV = stands for the sequence: company, lastname, firstname
  • NVF = stands for the sequence: lastname, firstname, company
  • NFV = stands for the sequence: lastname, company, firstname

standard.description: The standard debtor account that will be used if no matching debtor account can be found.

save.description: Flag that indicates if the debtor account shall be saved within the contact data.

locationId.description: The ID of the accounting location that the configuration belongs to

countryId.description: The ID of the country that the account configuration belongs to

revenueAccountLocationId.description: The ID configuration of the revenue account that these accounts are for.

id.description: The ID of the revenue account configuration

locationId.description: The ID of the accounting location that the configuration belongs to

accountEu.description: The account used for revenues that are exempt from VAT and that were sold within the European Union

accountExport.description: The account used for revenues that are exempt from VAT and that were sold to outside the European Union

id.description: The ID of the VAT configuration. A VAT configuration includes 4 VAT rates

countryId.description: The ID of the country that the VAT configuration belongs to

taxIdNumber.description: The tax id number of VAT configuration.

startedAt.description: The date when the VAT configuration went into effect

invalidFrom.description: The date when the VAT configuration should not be used any more

marginScheme.description: Specifies the tax rate that is used, when the margin scheme is applied. Available values: 'none', 'vat1', 'vat2', 'vat3', 'vat4'.

isRestrictedToDigitalItems.description: Flag that indicates if the VAT configuration is used only applied to digital goods or not. True= The VAT set is only applied to digital goods. False = The VAT set is applied to all types of goods.

isStandard.description: Flag that indicates if the VAT configuration is the standard VAT configuration for the location

createdAt.description: The date at which the VAT configuration was created.

updatedAt.description: The date that the VAT configuration was last updated.

accessToken.description: The access token. Required for REST call authentication.

tokenType.description: The token type. The token type is Bearer.

expiresIn.description: The expiration time in seconds that the access token is valid for

refreshToken.description: The refresh token. Required for refreshing the access token.

id.description: The ID of the shopping cart. The ID increases by 1 when a new customer enters the online store and adds an item to the shopping cart.

sessionId.description: The ID of the current customer session

customerInvoiceAddressId.description: The ID of the customer's invoice address

customerShippingAddressId.description: The ID of the customer's shipping address

referrerId.description: The ID of the order referrer

shippingCountryId.description: The ID of the shipping country

methodOfPaymentId.description: The ID of the payment method

shippingProviderId.description: The ID of the shipping provider

shippingProfileId.description: The ID of the shipping profile

itemSum.description: The gross value of items in the shopping cart

itemSumNet.description: The net value of items in the shopping cart

basketAmount.description: The total gross value of the shopping cart

basketAmountNet.description: The total net value of the shopping cart

couponDiscount.description: The received discount due to the coupon code

shippingDeleteByCoupon.description: Shows whether the shipping costs are subtracted due to a coupon code. Shopping carts that are free of shipping costs have the value true.

basketRebate.description: The discount to the shopping cart value. The discount can either be set as a discount scale for items, as a customer class discount or as a discount based on the payment method.

basketRebateType.description:
The discount type. The following types are available:
  • Discount scale based on net value of items = 4
  • Discount based on method of payment = 5

createdAt.description: The date that the shopping cart was created.

updatedAt.description: The date that the shopping cart was updated last.

id.description: The ID of the item in the shopping cart

basketId.description: The ID of the shopping cart. The ID increases by 1 when a new customer enters the online store and adds an item to the shopping cart.

sessionId.description: The ID of the current customer session

quantity.description: The current quantity of the item

quantityOriginally.description: The initial quantity of the item

itemId.description: The ID of the item

priceId.description: The ID of the item price

attributeValueSetId.description: The ID of the attribute value set

noEditByCustomer.description: Shows whether the item was edited by the customer

position.description: The item position

shippingProfileId.description: The ID of the shipping profile

referrerId.description: The ID of the order referrer

categoryId.description: The ID of the item category

variationId.description: The ID of the item variation

bundleVariationId.description: The ID of the item bundle type

createdAt.description: The date that the shopping cart was created

updatedAt.description: The date that the shopping cart was updated last

taskId.description: The ID of the task to create a reference for

referenceValue.description: Reference type followed by foreign ID of the referenced object. Syntax: TYPE-ID Example: user-123456 Types: user,ticket,contact,order,item

id.description: The unique ID of the category

parentCategoryId.description: The ID of the category's parent category. Value is null if category level is 1.

level.description: The category level of this category. This information is used for the sitemap.

type.description: The category type of the category

linklist.description: Flag that indicates if the category will be displayed in the online store's navigation.

right.description:
Flag that indicates who can see this category.
  • all = Category is visible to all visitors of the online store.
  • customer = Category and all of its subcategories are visible to visitors of the online store that have logged in only. Visitors that are not logged in are redirected to the login page.

sitemap.description: Flag that indicates if the category will be included in the sitemap.

updatedAt.description: The updated at timestamp of the category.

clients.description: Collection of the clients (stores) that belong to this category (List)

details.description: Collection of the category details that belong to this category (List)

category1Id.description: The ID of the category tree's 1st level. If 1st value is identical to category ID, category is of this level.

category2Id.description: The ID of the category tree's 2nd level. If 2nd level value is identical to category ID, category is of this level. If 2nd level value is null, category is of a higher level.

category3Id.description: The ID of the category tree's 3rd level. If 3rd level value is identical to category ID, category is of this level. If 2nd level value is null, category is of a higher level.

category4Id.description: The ID of the category tree's 4th level. If 4th level value is identical to category ID, category is of this level. If 2nd level value is null, category is of a higher level.

category5Id.description: The ID of the category tree's 5th level. If 5th level value is identical to category ID, category is of this level. If 2nd level value is null, category is of a higher level.

category6Id.description: The ID of the category tree's 6th level. If 6th level value is identical to category ID, category is of this level. If 2nd level value is null, category is of a higher level.

plentyId.description: The unique plenty ID of the client (store) in which the category is visible. Several IDs can be separated by commas. If a subcategory is linked to a client, its parent categories will be linked to this client as well.

categoryId.description: The unique ID of the category these category details belong to

plentyId.description: The unique plenty ID of the client (store) in which the category is visible. If a subcategory is linked to a client, its parent categories will be linked to this client as well.

lang.description: The language of the category

name.description: The name of the category. The same category name can be used more than once in different categories or on different category levels. However, category names must be unique within the same category or level.

description.description: The category text. The description is inserted into the online store using template variables.

description2.description: The category text 2. The description 2 is inserted into the online store using template variables.

shortDescription.description: The short description of the category. The short description can be inserted into the store's design using template variables.

metaKeywords.description: HTML meta keywords to tag the category for search engines. More than one keyword can be separated by commas.

metaDescription.description: The meta description of the category. This description is analysed by search engines and displayed in search results. This text should be treated as an advertising text to maximise click-through from search engine result pages. Current recommended limit is 156 characters.

nameUrl.description:
The category name to be used for the category's URL. The same URL name can be used more than once in different categories or on different category levels. However, URL names must be unique within the same category or level. The URL name should not be changed once the category is indexed by search engines. If no URL name is specified, the name will automatically be used as the URL name when the category is created.
Important: Name should contain ASCII code only and no special characters. The following character strings may not be used as prefixes to URL names: a-, b-, c-, f-, fa-, p-, t-. These prefixes will be removed automatically. For instance, a-class will be changed to class automatically. However, the URL name aclass can be used for a category named A-class.

metaTitle.description: This will be displayed as the title of a tab in the web browser and as a search result in search engines. If this is left blank, the category name will be used as the title. Current recommended limit is 50 characters. Longer titles will be cut off.

image.description: The ID to the image1 of the category.

image2.description: The ID to the image2 of the category.

imagePath.description: The path to the image1 of the category.

image2Path.description: The path to the image2 of the category.

position.description: The position of the category within a category level.

itemListView.description: The template the category is linked to for the category overview. The template determines what the category overview will look like for this category. This option is available for categories of the type Item only. Possible values: ItemViewCategoriesList, ItemViewCategoriesList2 to ItemViewCategoriesList10.

singleItemView.description: The template the category is linked to for the single item view. The template determines the appearance of the single item design for this category. This option is available for categories of the type Item only. Possible values: ItemViewSingleItem, ItemViewSingleItem2 to ItemViewSingleItem5.

fulltext.description:
Flag that indicates if the complete category text, i.e. the complete description, will be searched.
  • Y = Complete text will be searched.
  • N = Text will not be searched completely.

metaRobots.description:
Values from the meta element Robots are analyzed by Web crawlers. These values tell the crawler what it should do with the page and with the links on the page.
  • all = Include this category in the search engine index and follow the links on the page.
  • index = Include in the search engine index.
  • nofollow = Do not follow the links on the page.
  • noindex = Do not include in the search engine index.
  • nofollow, noindex = Do not follow the links and do not include the category in the search engine index.

canonicalLink.description:
The URL of any category that contains the same content. This
will avoid duplicate content.

updatedAt.description: The time the category details were last updated

updatedBy.description: The user who last updated the category details

  • item_variation
  • order_item

isVisibleForContact.description: If true, the comment is visible for the associated contact.

content.description: The base64 encodedcontent of the document.

lang.description: The language of the legal information text

type.description:
The type of the legal information text. The types available are:

plainText.description: The text value of the legal information text
